definition[1]: an ex gratia payment or amount is one made to help someone or as a gift, not because you have a legal duty to make it
example[1]: The government announced that it would make ex gratia payments to all investors who had suffered loss, while stressing that it had no legal liability to pay compensation.
example[2]: Compensation will be paid ex-gratia without the presumption of State liability.
